item.title: Kristin add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kristin add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Now the standard cure for one who is sunk is to consider those in actual destitution or physical suffering—this is an all-weather beatitude for gloom in general and fairly salutary day-time advice for everyone. But at three o’clock in the morning, a forgotten package has the same tragic importance as a death sentence, and the cure doesn’t work—and in a real dark night of the soul it is always three o’clock in the morning, day after day." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kristin add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Before I go on with this short history, let me make a general observation– the test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to function. One should, for example, be able to see that things are hopeless and yet be determined to make them otherwise. This philosophy fitted on to my early adult life, when I saw the improbable, the implausible, often the "impossible," come true." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kristin add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Here's to alcohol, the rose colored glasses of life." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Cintra Wilson
item.description: "Once a decision is made to be tasteful and risk-free, all spark, soul, variety, sleaze, spontaneity and fun go right out the window" -- Cintra Wilson
